channel.title: Joining 2 servers
channel.description:
my other post got locked, probably because i double posted byt ok.
anyways... i want to make two servers run off the same character file, obviously from the other post i made, i have no clue how to go about doing this. if someone could point me to the right direction.
ways i have went about trying this.
1. putting server1, server2, and character files all in 1 folder and setting the paths to go from that folder to character file. -fail... 2. putting server 2 inside of server 1, and setting the ./character path lead now to ./server2/character. that seemed to work while saving the file, but i couldnt get it to read the file for load.
any ways someone cann help me...?
and btw i dont think u should post if your just going to tell me that i should "just throw these 2 sources away because i fucked them up" or what ever, and u shouldnt post if ur not oging to help me. k thnx.

@hat_trix wrote:

thank you thats what i said in the begining in 1 sentence…

want to make two servers run off the same character file

Read full topic

item.title: Joining 2 servers
item.dc:creator: @spon80 spon80
item.description:
@spon80 wrote:

Like this? there are two different servers, ones named main server ones named pk server.
he wants the pk server to load the character files from main server. and when the player goes on dif server say main server it would load the information from pk server?

Read full topic

item.title: Joining 2 servers
item.dc:creator: @Project_Territh Project Territh
item.description:
@Project_Territh wrote:

Dude, this same EXACT thing happened to me when i was trying to create two servers with different ports. But I really am sorry I don’t get what you mean… if you could explain it more clearly then i might be able to help you. Yea i know it may seem like I’m a total noob because i am a first time poster, BUT i do have experience. I have created a server from scratch that i am working on right now. it may take me a while but I will find out how to fix this problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Joining 2 servers
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

ok.
i took two ssources.

source1
source2

i want the both to load from the same character file, that way i can change the port and have “2 different worlds” like on port 5555 and 43594

well i placed them both in a folder called… lets say… “bothserv” WITH the folders savedgames, characters, moreinfo,
i tried to set the path

("./savedGames/"+playerName+".dat")
("./moreinfo/"+playerName+".txt")

and

("./characters/"+playerName+".txt")

to this

("./bothserv/savedGames/"+playerName+".dat")
("./bothserv/moreinfo/"+playerName+".txt")

and

("./bothserv/characters/"+playerName+".txt")

but it said error writing file while saving and it wouldnt save. so i figured, if it wont let me load OUT of the actual server file, then i would place source2 inside of source 1 and change all of these in source 1

("./savedGames/"+playerName+".dat")
("./moreinfo/"+playerName+".txt")

and

("./characters/"+playerName+".txt")

to this

("./source2/savedGames/"+playerName+".dat")
("./source2/moreinfo/"+playerName+".txt")

and

("./source2/characters/"+playerName+".txt")

it saved the file fine like i wanted it to, it just wouldnt load it.
get what im saying? i explained it the best i could…

Read full topic

item.title: Joining 2 servers
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

well it wont let me put a path OUT of the server , and i changed ALL my paths to the second source on the first one and put the second one inside the first one, and it wouldnt load it, idk what i did wrong… i figured it would work also, it just woulndt load it. i even went through all the .java files and searched through them looking for paths to change and changed ALL the paths and the saving worked but the loading didnt.

Read full topic
